page.title: 02MID BORLAND FARM
page.content: The farm is 135 acres altogether with 48 acres for sillage.It is cut in June and August.The farmer, who is called Mr Carswell, has 3 tractors and 1 full time worker called Alec.He owns 170 cows and calves altogether of Friesian and Ayrshire breeds.They are milked twice a day by machine and pruduce an average of 1500 gallons per week. The cows eat barley,hay,straw,cake and sillage.Mr Carswell goes to the Scottish Milk Marketing Board to sell his milk and gets 74p per gallon.He goes to Paisley market to sell bull calves.The cows are taken in in October and let out in April.Mr Carswell has two barns to store straw and hay.Mr Carswell gets up at 6.30am every morning, gets off work at 12.00pm for lunch and 6.00pm for dinner.He goes to bed at 11.00pm every night.
